22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:13): surkov, in TextUpdater, where from the Substring comes from?

f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (19:14): look at xpcom/strings
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:15): surkov, right
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:15): surkov, it does not copy the string, right? it just does a reference?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:15): surkov, great, I needed that very much

47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (19:18): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=731287 nor, --, ---, surkov.alexander, ASSI, don't use GetComputedStyle for background-color in HTML table layout guess
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:24): surkov, I see you're firing events on substitution, insertion and deletion in this text updating ComputeTextChangeEvents, right?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:24): surkov, and to do that, you use full entries array, is that right?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:25): surkov, darn, I should have noticed that earlier ...
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (19:26): memory or speed optimization didn't take that into account?

22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:27): surkov, not directly. I know how to deduce all entity values from what I have computed right now, the entire algorithm is just about computing only determining values
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:28): surkov, it's just that I should have added cost of this computation into account
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:28): surkov, this deduction thing
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:28): surkov, anyway, I know that diff uses the same algorithm
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:29): surkov, and it does calculate necessary data somewhere on the line
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:29): surkov, so I'll look into it
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:29): surkov, is there a reason why you fire the events starting from the final cell?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:29): surkov, other than it's the easiest way to reconstruct the path
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (19:30): no "front-end" reason
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (19:30): if you ask about this
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:30): surkov, or said other way: is there any particular order in which the events should be fired?
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:30): surkov, or can I do it anyway
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (19:31): order doesn't matter, you just need to be consistent, so superposition of events should give you a string
22625f683d3bf3dd883140da90753a5c (19:34): surkov, thanks
